Articles.Content:
![ggIf3fM.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ggIf3fM.jpg)
**M46 Patton**

**Designer: Zekes**

**Status:****COMPLETED**

**Cost: $373,984.00**

**The M46 was an American tank designed to replace the M26 Pershing and M4 Sherman. It was one of the U.S Army's principal medium tanks of the early Cold War, with models in service from 1949 to the mid-1950s.** 

**Comes with rotating turret, simply switch to it and "control from here" on the front pod, just behind the gun. Camouflage not included.**

***Download:*** [***http://www./download/m3m7u9xn3qa0u80/M46+Patton.craft***](http://www./download/m3m7u9xn3qa0u80/M46+Patton.craft)
I think we can start competition for bringing these things to Mun.
Or loading them onto cargo airplanes...

> 
> Or loading them onto cargo airplanes...

Yeah right... and airdrop them, of course.

> 
> I think we can start competition for bringing these things to Mun.

Some guy on r/KSP/ did this with my TOG II , and didn't give me credit ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

> 
> Yeah right... and airdrop them, of course.

And try to land it A-Team style! Once ATM finishes loading all the textures.

> 
> And try to land it A-Team style! Once ATM finishes loading all the textures.

Not to mention they weigh some 35 tons each....
I like how some of the road-wheels are busted in the picture. Battle damage?

> 
> I like how some of the road-wheels are busted in the picture. Battle damage?

I bounced the tank a bit coming off the runway, being careless, yeah ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) 34 tons is heavy for the chassis, it's close to the limit.

Might you consider making a replica of the *Neubaufahrzeug* ?

![neubaufahrzeug.jpg](http://www.lonesentry.com/ordnance/wp-content/uploads/2010/07/neubaufahrzeug.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-26T03:45:53Z" title="06/26/2015 03:45  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 26, 2015</time> by Jon144**

> 
> Might you consider making a replica of the *Neubaufahrzeug* ?
> [http://www.lonesentry.com/ordnance/wp-content/uploads/2010/07/neubaufahrzeug.jpg](http://www.lonesentry.com/ordnance/wp-content/uploads/2010/07/neubaufahrzeug.jpg)

I'm considering it... would be super easy to modify into a T-35 too
Finally! Zekes made an American tank.

> 
> Finally! Zekes made an American tank.

I also made an M26 Pershing and a T26E4 Super Pershing (not released yet), and I'm working on this....

.... don't get your hopes up too much though, the turret is abysmally hard.

![3H7XlUu.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/3H7XlUu.jpg)

hi !

I really like your M46 Patton , really beautiful !

Don't know why but i'm not good for build tanks & it's a perfect target for my copters ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Good Job !

> 
> I also made an M26 Pershing and a T26E4 Super Pershing (not released yet), and I'm working on this....
> .... don't get your hopes up too much though, the turret is abysmally hard.
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/3H7XlUu.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/3H7XlUu.jpg)

Is building the turret the issue or the bearing? I have some small bearings that can fit in there very easily.

> 
> Is building the turret the issue or the bearing? I have some small bearings that can fit in there very easily.

The problem is it's a molded turret, which means it's insanely hard to do in KSP on account of the rounding literally everywhere. It's also small, smaller than any other turret I've made, and it's hard to get it in the right proportions. The bearing should be fine, it's aethetics I'm hung up on.

![SH44.jpg](http://www.strijdbewijs.nl/tanks/sherman/SH44.jpg)

> 
> The problem is it's a molded turret, which means it's insanely hard to do in KSP on account of the rounding literally everywhere. It's also small, smaller than any other turret I've made, and it's hard to get it in the right proportions. The bearing should be fine, it's aethetics I'm hung up on.
> [http://www.strijdbewijs.nl/tanks/sherman/SH44.jpg](http://www.strijdbewijs.nl/tanks/sherman/SH44.jpg)

perhaps you should try the later modelled turrets? they were bigger and more square

> 
> perhaps you should try the later modelled turrets? they were bigger and more square

It ended up working out okay. Plus from this one I can make it into the late-war turret (maybe)

![bb9OjbH.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/bb9OjbH.jpg)

Who says jeeps can't win against tanks...

![2HA65mn.png](http://i.imgur.com/2HA65mn.png)

![VVfDFir.png](http://i.imgur.com/VVfDFir.png)

![QzhXcAC.png](http://i.imgur.com/QzhXcAC.png)

![wuzDp3g.png](http://i.imgur.com/wuzDp3g.png)

You would not believe how hard it was to get those unguided missiles to hit that tank...

> 
> Who says jeeps can't win against tanks...
> [http://i.imgur.com/2HA65mn.png](http://i.imgur.com/2HA65mn.png)
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/VVfDFir.png](http://i.imgur.com/VVfDFir.png)
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/QzhXcAC.png](http://i.imgur.com/QzhXcAC.png)
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/wuzDp3g.png](http://i.imgur.com/wuzDp3g.png)
> 
> You would not believe how hard it was to get those unguided missiles to hit that tank...

I absolutely love your jeep, and the mortar in the back! IT's awesome.

> 
> I absolutely love your jeep, and the mortar in the back! IT's awesome.

Thanks! With luck, you'll see a release today!
